summary: This is the Federal Bureau of Prisons 24-hour death report for inmate Jeffery Edward Epstein, documenting his death by alleged suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on August 10, 2019. The report details the clinical synopsis of events leading to his death, including his placement on and removal from suicide watch, and the medical response when he was found unresponsive.

persons.name: Jeffery Edward Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate, a 66-year-old male with a history of sleep apnea and other medical conditions, who was found unresponsive in his cell and pronounced dead at a hospital.

persons.name: Terrance Thomas
persons.context: The Bureau of Prisons employee (ID B0152781/SOP52781) who submitted the 24-hour death notification.

events.title: Epstein placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: At 2:00 a.m., Epstein was placed on Suicide Watch for 31 hours and 5 minutes due to an abrasion on his neck.

events.title: Epstein taken off Suicide Watch
events.description: Epstein was removed from Suicide Watch and placed on Psychological Observation.

events.title: Epstein placed in Special Housing Unit
events.description: Epstein was removed from Psychological Observation and placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) with a cell mate.

events.title: Psychology Services evaluation
events.description: Epstein was seen by Psychology Services and denied suicidal ideation, intention, or plan.

events.title: Epstein found unresponsive and pronounced dead
events.description: At 6:33 a.m., SHU staff found Epstein unresponsive. CPR and medical intervention were performed. He was transported to New York Presbyterian Lower Manhattan Hospital and pronounced dead by the ER physician at 7:36 a.m.

locations: MCC New York, 150 Park Row, NY, NY 10007
New York Presbyterian Lower Manhattan Hospital
keyFacts: Jeffery Edward Epstein died on August 10, 2019, at 7:36 a.m., pronounced at New York Presbyterian Lower Manhattan Hospital.
The preliminary cause of death is listed as 'Alleged Suicide' and an autopsy was ordered.
Epstein had been on Suicide Watch from July 23-24, 2019, due to an abrasion on his neck, but was removed and later placed in the Special Housing Unit with a cellmate.
On August 8, 2019, just two days before his death, Epstein denied any suicidal ideation, intention, or plan to Psychology Services.
The death notification was formally submitted by Bureau of Prisons staff member Terrance Thomas on August 12, 2019.
